title: Cut locus
summary: The cut locus is a mathematical structure defined for a closed set S {\displaystyle S} in a space X {\displaystyle X} as the closure of the set of all points p âˆˆ X {\displaystyle p\in X} that have two or more distinct shortest paths in X {\displaystyle X} from S {\displaystyle S} to p {\displaystyle p} .
